Despite the efforts of anti-LGBTQ extremists, Drag Queen Story Time will go on in Lafayette.

Dear ##SM_RULE_360 Email Salutation##,

When the rights of LGBTQ Louisianans come under attack, it's on all of us to stand together and defend them. That's why last month, when library officials in Lafayette tried to ban drag queens from reading to children in public library spaces, we fought back.

Caving in to a group of anti-LGBTQ extremists, library officials required anyone who wanted to use a library meeting room to sign a form saying they were not affiliated with Drag Queen Story Time.

We filed suit and challenged this discriminatory policy as a violation of First Amendment rights — and today we're proud to report that the library agreed to cancel its policy, effective immediately!

This is good news for our clients and everyone in Lafayette who will once again be able to use library facilities without being censored by library officials.

Read more about Drag Queen Story Time and this victory for LGBTQ rights.

READ THE STORY

Moving forward, we're going to stay vigilant against attempts to discriminate against LGBTQ Louisianans.

The fight against anti-LGBTQ extremism isn't over, but with your help we'll build a future where no one is discriminated against for being themselves. Follow us on Facebook and Twitter for the latest updates on the fight for justice in Louisiana.

Thank you,

ACLU of Louisiana
